questions.question_text: An engineer is implementing a wireless design for a service provider. The design includes a Catalyst 9800, a stack of two Catalyst 9300X-48HX switches, and 9166 APs. Each AP must be named using the Floor-439412509-01X sting where X is the area number. The engineer wants to connect the APs to the switch stack using POE. How many APs must the engineer connect to the stack so the APs run using full functionalities?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Leading PoE capabilities with up to 384 ports of PoE per stack, PoE+, and 288 ports high density IEEE 802.3bt-90W UPOE+, and 60W Cisco UPOE.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/switches/catalyst-9300-series-switches/nb-06-cat9300-ser-data-sheet-cte-en.html

Selected Answer: D
Given the power limitations of each Catalyst 9300X-48HX switch, the correct answer is **D. half ports per switch**. Each switch can support a limited number of APs with full PoE functionality. By distributing the APs across both switches, the engineer ensures that each AP receives adequate power and network connectivity without exceeding the power limits of the switches.

Selected Answer: D
C9300X-48HX’s default PSU can supply up to 590W while C9166 requires at least 25.5W to run on full functionality. It doesn't say the design includes dual PSU on the switch.

see Table 4
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/switches/catalyst-9300-series-switches/nb-06-cat9300-ser-data-sheet-cte-en.html

see Input power requirements
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/wireless/catalyst-9166-series-access-points/catalyst-9166-series-access-points-ds.html

The Cisco data sheet for the C9300X-48HX with a default build i.e. 1 x 1100W PSU (no 2nd PSU or an upgrade to the 1900W PSU) can provide a PoE budget of 590W.

The 9166 APs require a minimum and with all radios on 802.3at (PoE+). This is with the USB port off/unpowered. This is 25.5W per AP.

Or 802.3bt (UPOE) with the USB port now on (takes 4.5W). The AP running at full functionality requires 30.5W max.

So this is either:

Default PoE budget of 590W / 25.5W = 23 APs

Or default PoE budget of 590W / 30.5W = 19 APs

So the answer must be half ports per switch and that isn't really possible except the resting power draw may be a little less.
